chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to a Witness

result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry D. Moore Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larry D. Moore in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Larry D. Moore in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-165, 224, 253, 360, 13CM-547 and 14CM-181.

9:56 AM Court calls case and states appearances.

13CM-547 Defendant will plead to
14CF-165 Amend count 1 to MS Battery 940.19(1) Defendant will plead to  Ct 1 and 2 and 3. 
14CF-224, 14CF-253 and 14CF-360 Dismissed and read in
14CM-181 Defendant will plead to

Atty Constable states the plea agreement for the record.
Atty Renc concurs, there is 50 days of jail credit.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 13CM-547 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-165 NO CONTEST to Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CM-181 NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Renc for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
13CM-547 Disorderly Conduct 
14CF-165 Count 1 - amended to Misdemeanor Battery and Count 2 and Count 3
14CM-181 Disorderly Conduct
14CF-224 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-253 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-360 Dismissed and Read In

State has complied with victim notification statutes

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. Days credit are addressed.
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:

14CF-165:
Count 1: - amended
150 Days Jail Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 3 Years 
52 Days Credit in event probation is revoked
Huber if approved by jail administration
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations from assessment
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by agent
Go to school full time, work full time or combination of both to equal full time
Will allow early dicharge if in full compliance and recommended by the agent.

Count 2:
60 day Jail Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to Count 1
Probation for a period of 3 Years, concurrent to Count 1
52 Days Credit
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 
Pay costs
Will allow early dicharge if in full compliance and recommended by the agent

Count 3:
90 day Jail Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Probation for a period of 3 Years, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
52 Days Credit
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 and Count 2 
Pay costs
Will allow early dicharge if in full compliance and recommended by the agent

13CM-547:
30 day Jail Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to 14CF-165
Probation for a period of 3 Years concurrent to 14CF-165
Only gets 50 days pretrial credit if this is the only case that Defendant is revoked on
Conditions:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 14CF-165
Pay costs

14CM-181:
30 day Jail, Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to any sentence Defendant may be serving
Probation for a period of 3 Years, concurrent to 13CM-547 and 14CF-165
Only gets 50 days pretrial credit if this is the only case that Defendant is revoked on
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 13CM-547 and 14CF-165
Pay costs

Appeal rights are addressed. Any money posted in cases shall be applied to court costs that have been imposed in all cases.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
$5,000 cash bond to cover cases 13CM547, 14CF165, 14CF224, 14CF253, and 14CM181.  Comply with conditions as previously set.

Attorney Anne Renc in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Larry D Moore appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 13CM547, 14CF165, 14CF224, 14CF253, 14CM181.
Atty Renc request $2,500 cash bond.
ADA Constable request $10,000 cash bond.
BTC:  $5,000 cash bond to cover cases 13CM547, 14CF165, 14CF224, 14CF253, and 14CM181.  Comply with conditions as previously set.
Case 14CF224 preliminary on 10-06-14 at 3:00 p.m.
13CM547, 14CF165, 14CF253, and 14CM181 set for status.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Larry D Moore not in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney  Anne Renc in court for Defendant Larry D Moore. Prosecuting Atty Cass Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. BTC:  Warrant on  cases 13CM547, 14CF224, 14CF165, and 14CM181.
Status conference on July 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on June 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2014 at 10:15 am.

Atty Renc has received a copy of the information and waives reading.

Bond is ordered continued.

13CM-547, 14CM-181 are to track with this case.

Defendant Larry D. Moore in court with attorney Anne J Renc. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

3:12 PM Court calls case.
Atty Isherwood states appearances.

Matter is set for a preliminary hearing today.
Court did receive a form waiving hearing.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney Renc.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Atty Renc
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Not have any contact with SPASH or be within 2000 feet of that school for any purpose, day or night. 
Not have any contact or be within 2000 feet of any sporting event that SPASH may be involved in, all sports including. Not to be near any of those. 
Not to be at the Alternatives School unless they allow him to attend there.  If they are allowing it, they are to use their own discretion.  If not allowing it, not to be within 1000 feet of the Alternatives School.   **AMENDED 4/22/14 TTF - Except when he has an appointment with his attorney in that building.**  
Not possess/consume any alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed. 
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *14 times per week.  Every morning and every afternoon.
**AMENDED 4/22/14 TTF** Day report 7 times per week, provided he provides proof of employment to day report.  If he loses the job, then it will be back to 14 days per week.

Defendant Larry D Moore in court with attorney Anne J Renc. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard:  13CM547 (Plea hearing) 14CM181, 14CF165 (Initial Appearances)

Atty Renc indicates the plea hin 13CM547 is off and would like to have initial appearances on the new files. 

14CF165: 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

14CM181:
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered. 
Set for status conference on the same date and time as the prelim in 14CF165. 

Atty Renc makes arguments in regards to bond.  Asks to lower the day report to 7 times per week as the defendant has started work at Taco Bell for 2 p.m. to 8 p.m. 
Atty Isherwood makes arguments.  Asks defendant to show him his schedule. 
Atty Renc makes additional arguments regarding the bond in 14CF165.  Her office is located in the same building as the Alternative School 

BY THE COURT:  
Except when he has an appointment with his attorney in that building. 

Atty Isherwood asks that Atty Renc notify the principal when he is coming and when he will be leaving from the office.  

Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Not have any contact with SPASH or be within 2000 feet of that school for any purpose, day or night. 
Not have any contact or be within 2000 feet of any sporting event that SPASH may be involved in, all sports including. Not to be near any of those. 
Not to be at the Alternatives School unless they allow him to attend there.  If they are allowing it, they are to use their own discretion.  If not allowing it, not to be within 1000 feet of the Alternatives School. 
Not possess/consume any alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed. 
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *14 times per week.  Every morning and every afternoon.

ADA Veronica Isherwood appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Drury appears from jail by video.  Indicates Atty Anne Renc is representing this defendant on underlying charges and believes she will be appointed to this case as well. 

ADA Isherwood states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct, Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court advises defendant of right to Counsel/public defender representation. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  4/22/14 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3

Atty Isherwood makes arguments for bond and recommends a $1,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Drury requests to speak with the defendant prior to make statements.  (Mic is muted and he consults with the defendant).
Atty Drury makes statements to the Court.
Atty Isherwood makes additional statements.  Questions if the defendant is staying with his mother yet.
Atty Drury states address.
